comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: see also - www.powerhousemuseum.com/imageservices/index.php/2010/03/... Hotel opened on 14 January 1890. This photo must be about that time because the southern half of the Lands Department Building (completed 1891) is under construction. Strange that there are not more people around - apart from the person on the balcony, the hotel looks shut. I would imagine that there would be staff / porters standing outside to welcome guests and carriages. Maybe the photo is full of ghosts!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Interesting to compare with Henry King's photo (of the Library next door) at about the same time - the scaffolding of the Lands Department Building is apparent - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362660609/

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's a Sydney Mail article which appeared at the time of the opening in January 1890...article on p.140; pic on p.139 - news.google.com/newspapers?id=nFwQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=SpMDA...
